bill_title: consolidate the categories of real estate licenses.

bill_versions.bill_text: SEVENTY-SEVENTH SESSION LEGISLATIVE ASSEMBLY, 2002 FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to consolidate the categories of real estate licenses. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 36-21A be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: Any person licensed as a real estate salesperson pursuant to this chapter shall, within two years of the effective date of this Act, complete forty hours of prescribed education in a course approved by the commission. Any real estate salesperson whose license is inactive shall complete the prescribed education and course examination requirements before activating that license. The commission shall promulgate rules, pursuant to chapter 1-26, to specify requirements for the course and examination. This section does not apply to residents of another licensing jurisdiction who are licensed in South Dakota under the provisions of a reciprocal agreement with that jurisdiction. Section 2. That chapter 36-21A be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: Any salesperson who has completed the requirements of section 1 of this Act shall file an application for a broker associate license before the end of the current license term. Section 3. That § 36-21A-30.1 be amended to read as follows: 36-21A-30.1. An applicant for a broker associate license must have completed one hundred class hours of education in a course of study approved by the commission given by instructors approved by the commission or in a correspondence an independent study or distance education course approved by the commission. The commission may adopt rules , pursuant to chapter 1-26 , to specify requirements for the course of study , qualifications of an instructor, and criteria for a correspondence an independent study or distance education course. An applicant for a broker associate license who holds a sales license as of July 1, 1996, shall complete sixty hours of education beyond the salesperson level in a course of study approved by the commission. Section 4. That § 36-21A-31 be amended to read as follows: 36-21A-31. An applicant for a responsible broker's license must shall have served actively for two years as a licensed salesperson or broker associate, or a combination thereof, and shall furnish evidence of completion of fifteen additional class hours beyond the broker associate level in a course of study approved by the commission given by instructors approved by the commission or in a correspondence an independent study or distance education course approved by the commission. The commission may adopt rules , pursuant to chapter 1-26 , to specify requirements for the course of study. Any person licensed as a broker associate under section 1 of this Act shall, in addition to the education requirements of this section, complete the broker examination requirements to qualify as a responsible broker. Any broker licensed prior to July 1, 1996, is exempt from these requirements. Section 5. That § 36-21A-34 be repealed. 36-21A-34. An applicant for a real estate salesperson's license, in addition to the other requirements of law, shall furnish evidence to the commission of completion of sixty class hours in a course of study approved by the commission given by instructors approved by the commission or in a correspondence course approved by the commission. The commission may adopt rules pursuant to chapter 1-26 to specify requirements for the course of study. Section 6. This Act is effective on January 1, 2003.
